para.text: It is unlawful for any person to knowingly launch or throw an object onto the residential property of another with the intent to cause fear, intimidate, or harass any person living or working at that residence.
A person who violates this section, upon conviction, shall be fined no more than the amount set forth in § 22-3571.01, or incarcerated for no more than 90 days, or both.

annotations.annotation: For temporary (90 days) creation of this section, see § 2(c) of Residential Tranquility Emergency Amendment Act of 2024 (D.C. Act 25-622, Nov. 4, 2024, 71 DCR 13558).
For temporary (90 days) creation of this section, see § 2(c) of Residential Tranquility Congressional Review Emergency Amendment Act of 2025 (D.C. Act 26-2, Jan. 31, 2025, 72 DCR 1130).
For temporary (90 days) creation of this section, see § 2(c) of Residential Tranquility Second Congressional Review Emergency Amendment Act of 2025 (D.C. Act 26-55, Apr. 22, 2025, 72 DCR 4916).
For temporary (90 days) creation of this section, see § 2(c) of Residential Tranquility Emergency Amendment Act of 2025 (D.C. Act 26-119, July 21, 2025, 72 DCR 8178).
For temporary (90 days) creation of this section, see § 3a of Residential Tranquility Second Congressional Review Emergency Amendment Act of 2025 (D.C. Act 26-153, Oct. 3, 2025, 72 DCR 10901).
